questions.text: What is the capital of India?
questions.explanation:
New Delhi is the capital of India.
It is located in the northern part of India.

questions.text: Which is the longest river in India?
questions.explanation:
Ganga is the longest river in India (2,525 km).
It originates from Gangotri Glacier in Uttarakhand.

questions.text: Which is the highest peak in India?
questions.explanation:
Kanchenjunga (8,586 m) is the highest peak in India.
It is located in Sikkim.

questions.text: Which is the largest state in India by area?
questions.explanation:
Rajasthan is the largest state in India by area.
Its capital is Jaipur, also known as the Pink City.

questions.text: Which city is known as the 'Silicon Valley of India'?
questions.explanation:
Bengaluru is known as the 'Silicon Valley of India'.
It is the IT capital of India.

questions.text: How many states are there in India?
questions.explanation:
There are 28 states in India.
There are also 8 Union Territories.

questions.text: Which river is known as 'Dakshin Ganga'?
questions.explanation:
Godavari is known as 'Dakshin Ganga'.
It is the longest river in South India.

questions.text: What is the capital of Maharashtra?
questions.explanation:
Mumbai is the capital of Maharashtra.
It is also the financial capital of India.

questions.text: Which is the oldest mountain range in India?
questions.explanation:
Aravalli is the oldest mountain range in India.
It is located in Rajasthan.

questions.text: Which state is the largest producer of tea in India?
questions.explanation:
Assam is the largest producer of tea in India.
Assam tea is famous worldwide.
